queries.description: Privileged containers lack essential security restrictions and should be avoided by removing the 'privileged' flag or by changing its value to false

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{init-db2}}.securityContext.privileged is true

queries.query_name: Non Kube System Pod With Host Mount
queries.description: A non kube-system workload should not have hostPath mounted

files.expected_value: Resource name 'release-na-ibm-db2-db2u' of kind 'StatefulSet' in a non kube-system namespace 'default' should not have hostPath '/proc' mounted
files.actual_value: Resource name 'release-na-ibm-db2-db2u' of kind 'StatefulSet' in a non kube-system namespace 'default' has a hostPath '/proc' mounted

files.expected_value: Resource name 'release-na-ibm-db2-db2u' of kind 'StatefulSet' in a non kube-system namespace 'default' should not have hostPath '/proc/sys' mounted
files.actual_value: Resource name 'release-na-ibm-db2-db2u' of kind 'StatefulSet' in a non kube-system namespace 'default' has a hostPath '/proc/sys' mounted

queries.description: Containers should not run with allowPrivilegeEscalation in order to prevent them from gaining more privileges than their parent process

files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u-sqllib-shared-job}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2-init}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation is true
metadata.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation is true
metadata.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{init-db2}}.securityContext.allowPrivilegeEscalation is true

queries.query_name: Volume Mount With OS Directory Write Permissions
queries.description: Containers can mount sensitive folders from the hosts, giving them potentially dangerous access to critical host configurations and binaries.

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.volumeMounts.name={{dshm}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.volumeMounts.name={{dshm}}.readOnly is undefined

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.volumeMounts.name={{runvol}}.readOnly should be defined and set to true
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.spec.template.spec.containers.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.volumeMounts.name={{runvol}}.readOnly is undefined

queries.query_name: Workload Mounting With Sensitive OS Directory
queries.description: Workload is mounting a volume with sensitive OS Directory

files.expected_value: Workload name 'release-na-ibm-db2-db2u' of kind 'StatefulSet' should not mount a host sensitive OS directory '/proc' with hostPath
files.actual_value: Workload name 'release-na-ibm-db2-db2u' of kind 'StatefulSet' is mounting a host sensitive OS directory '/proc' with hostPath

files.expected_value: Workload name 'release-na-ibm-db2-db2u' of kind 'StatefulSet' should not mount a host sensitive OS directory '/proc/sys' with hostPath
files.actual_value: Workload name 'release-na-ibm-db2-db2u' of kind 'StatefulSet' is mounting a host sensitive OS directory '/proc/sys' with hostPath

queries.description: Containers should only run as non-root user. This limits the exploitability of security misconfigurations and restricts an attacker's possibilities in case of compromise

files.expected_value: metadata.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{init-db2}}.securityContext.runAsUser is higher than 0 and/or 'runAsNonRoot' is true
files.actual_value: metadata.name={{release-na-ibm-db2-db2u}}.spec.template.spec.initContainers.name={{init-db2}}.securityContext.runAsUser is 0 and 'runAsNonRoot' is false

queries.description: Check if containers are running with low UID, which might cause conflicts with the host's user table.
